item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Pein came from a failed german translator who didnt know what she was doing. Everyone kept taking the german form, so everyone thinks his name is Pein. Its PAIN dammit, learn it already!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Actually, Pein is meaning Pain - it's german for pain.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Actually, according to what I read the japanese spelling of his name it translates to be spelled as Pein. But his english name is officially Pain. At least, that is what the six paths are called, the true body is still called Nagato, not Pain. And yes, I agree that the reason for the name of Rayne is because its sounds like Rain, and Pein sounds like Pain. And yes, he did indeed have a jutsu that caused rain so he he could sense the presense of anyone in the rains area. So, the name is both based off of the wierd spelling of Pein and his jutsu that makes it Rain.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Wouldn't it be J-Diddy, Rayne, and The Paper? The other student is dead or missing, so it might do it. Will have to check it out once I can pass the mission.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Has anyone ever paired Rayne with J-Diddy?

item.title: Rayne
item.content:encoded: There is also the fact that pain, is also spelled wierd (Pein) and this is a wierd spelling for Rain.

item.title: Rayne Continued
item.content:encoded: After all, one of Pain's signature techniques was the ability to produce rain that allowed him to sense the presence of anyone who got caught in it.

item.title: Rayne
item.content:encoded: I assume that Rayne is based on Pain from the Akatsuki, but I'm not certain of this.
